      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean drive2Exit()
      Drives the robot towards the exit given it exists and given the robot's energy supply lasts long enough.
      float getEnergyConsumption()
      Returns the total energy consumption of the journey, i.e., the difference between the robot's initial energy level at the starting position and its energy level at the exit position.

    • Method Detail

      • setRobot

        public void setRobot(Robot r)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Assigns a robot platform to the driver. The driver uses a robot to perform, this method provides it with this necessary information.
        Specified by:
        setRobot in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        r - robot to operate

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(int width,
                          int height)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the dimensions of the 2D maze measured in the number of cells in each direction.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        width - of the maze
        height - of the maze

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(Distance distance)
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Provides the robot driver with information on the distance to the exit. Only some drivers such as the wizard rely on this information to find the exit.
        Specified by:
        setDistance in interface RobotDriver
        Parameters:
        distance - gives the length of path from current position to the exit.

      • drive2Exit

        public boolean drive2Exit()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Drives the robot towards the exit given it exists and given the robot's energy supply lasts long enough.
        Specified by:
        drive2Exit in interface RobotDriver
        Returns:
        true if driver successfully reaches the exit, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getEnergyConsumption

        public float getEnergyConsumption()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total energy consumption of the journey, i.e., the difference between the robot's initial energy level at the starting position and its energy level at the exit position. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyConsumption in interface RobotDriver

      • setPathLength

        public void setPathLength(int pathLength)

      • getPathLength

        public int getPathLength()
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Returns the total length of the journey in number of cells traversed. Being at the initial position counts as 0. This is used as a measure of efficiency for a robot driver.
        Specified by:
        getPathLength in interface RobotDriver
